title: That closed session report LSOCS24-008 dated November 18, 2024 of the City Solicitor respecting Review of OMB Appeal re OPA 173 and Zoning By-law 16-053 be received for information.

nn) That a by-law be passed to establish the 2025 tax ratios for each property class as set out in the 2025 Operating Budget. (Page 279) oo) That the 2025 tax rate for farmland awaiting development subclasses be 75% of the residential rate. (Page 279)

(page 53 Appendix B of Report FCSFS24-036) That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report LSOCS24-006, dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: That Parking By-law 09-136 be amended in the form of amending by-law comprising Appendix A to Report LSOCS24-006. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report LSMLES24-005 dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: a) That Council approve the establishment of four (4) full time CUPE 126 employee positions as Municipal Law Enforcement Officers (Level I) in 2025 at an anticipated cost of $61,500, plus benefits and related costs of $18,000 per Officer for a total anticipated cost of $318,000 ($246,000, plus benefits and related costs of $72,000) for an anticipated Operating Budget net increase of $81,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. b) That Council approve the establishment of a Non-Union Supervisor position at an anticipated cost of $104,000 plus benefits and related costs of $28,000 for a total anticipated Operating Budget increase of $132,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. c) That Council approve the establishment of a Capital Project to fund the purchase of two (2) hybrid-electric patrol vehicles at a cost of $52,000 dollars each and necessary modifications totalling an additional $52,000, for a total of $156,000 and the purchase of two (2) e-bicycles at a cost of $3,500 each as well as accessories necessary to transport the e-bicycles at a cost of up to $1,100, for a total of $8,100 for a grand total of $164,100 for the Capital Project be funded from the general tax levy.

nn) That a by-law be passed to establish the 2025 tax ratios for each property class as set out in the 2025 Operating Budget. (Page 279) oo) That the 2025 tax rate for farmland awaiting development subclasses be 75% of the residential rate. (Page 279) That Council move into Closed Session to discuss a matter under Municipal Act Section 239(2)(d) labour relations or employee negotiations at 10:36 a.m. That advertising expenses be reduced by $15,000 for Strategic Communications Division, as per Appendix B of Report FCSFS24-036. (page 41) That preventative maintenance and custodial costs for facilities be reduced by $153,000. (page 53 Appendix B of Report FCSFS24-036) That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report LSOCS24-006, dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: That Parking By-law 09-136 be amended in the form of amending by-law comprising Appendix A to Report LSOCS24-006. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report LSMLES24-005 dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: a) That Council approve the establishment of four (4) full time CUPE 126 employee positions as Municipal Law Enforcement Officers (Level I) in 2025 at an anticipated cost of $61,500, plus benefits and related costs of $18,000 per Officer for a total anticipated cost of $318,000 ($246,000, plus benefits and related costs of $72,000) for an anticipated Operating Budget net increase of $81,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. b) That Council approve the establishment of a Non-Union Supervisor position at an anticipated cost of $104,000 plus benefits and related costs of $28,000 for a total anticipated Operating Budget increase of $132,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. c) That Council approve the establishment of a Capital Project to fund the purchase of two (2) hybrid-electric patrol vehicles at a cost of $52,000 dollars each and necessary modifications totalling an additional $52,000, for a total of $156,000 and the purchase of two (2) e-bicycles at a cost of $3,500 each as well as accessories necessary to transport the e-bicycles at a cost of up to $1,100, for a total of $8,100 for a grand total of $164,100 for the Capital Project be funded from the general tax levy. That the Climate Change Coordinator FTE proposed in the budget, be eliminated.

nn) That a by-law be passed to establish the 2025 tax ratios for each property class as set out in the 2025 Operating Budget. (Page 279) oo) That the 2025 tax rate for farmland awaiting development subclasses be 75% of the residential rate. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report LSMLES24-005 dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: a) That Council approve the establishment of four (4) full time CUPE 126 employee positions as Municipal Law Enforcement Officers (Level I) in 2025 at an anticipated cost of $61,500, plus benefits and related costs of $18,000 per Officer for a total anticipated cost of $318,000 ($246,000, plus benefits and related costs of $72,000) for an anticipated Operating Budget net increase of $81,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. b) That Council approve the establishment of a Non-Union Supervisor position at an anticipated cost of $104,000 plus benefits and related costs of $28,000 for a total anticipated Operating Budget increase of $132,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. c) That Council approve the establishment of a Capital Project to fund the purchase of two (2) hybrid-electric patrol vehicles at a cost of $52,000 dollars each and necessary modifications totalling an additional $52,000, for a total of $156,000 and the purchase of two (2) e-bicycles at a cost of $3,500 each as well as accessories necessary to transport the e-bicycles at a cost of up to $1,100, for a total of $8,100 for a grand total of $164,100 for the Capital Project be funded from the general tax levy. That the Climate Change Coordinator FTE proposed in the budget, be eliminated. That staff prepare a report on strategies on how to generate revenue and fully utilize the parking garages at Simcoe and King Streets in addition to surface parking, to accommodate future growth and development; and, That the DBIA be consulted. (page 97)

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report LSMLES24-005 dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner, Legislative Services as follows: a) That Council approve the establishment of four (4) full time CUPE 126 employee positions as Municipal Law Enforcement Officers (Level I) in 2025 at an anticipated cost of $61,500, plus benefits and related costs of $18,000 per Officer for a total anticipated cost of $318,000 ($246,000, plus benefits and related costs of $72,000) for an anticipated Operating Budget net increase of $81,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. b) That Council approve the establishment of a Non-Union Supervisor position at an anticipated cost of $104,000 plus benefits and related costs of $28,000 for a total anticipated Operating Budget increase of $132,000 in 2025 to be funded from the general tax levy. c) That Council approve the establishment of a Capital Project to fund the purchase of two (2) hybrid-electric patrol vehicles at a cost of $52,000 dollars each and necessary modifications totalling an additional $52,000, for a total of $156,000 and the purchase of two (2) e-bicycles at a cost of $3,500 each as well as accessories necessary to transport the e-bicycles at a cost of up to $1,100, for a total of $8,100 for a grand total of $164,100 for the Capital Project be funded from the general tax levy. That the Climate Change Coordinator FTE proposed in the budget, be eliminated. That staff prepare a report on strategies on how to generate revenue and fully utilize the parking garages at Simcoe and King Streets in addition to surface parking, to accommodate future growth and development; and, That the DBIA be consulted. (page 97) That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPGACP24-033 dated November 18, 2024, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure, Planning and Growth Management as follows: That Report IPGACP24-033 be received for information. a) That the report IPGENG24-025, be received for information. b) That staff report back by the third quarter of 2025 on a strategy to reduce rates of speed, including the feasibility of 40 km rate city wide That the budget increase for sidewalk reconstruction be set at a 1.5% increase (page 161). That the single transit ride fare be increased by 25 cents (page 3 Appendix B, Report FCSS24-036). That the free transit program for youth and high school students be implemented by September 2025; and, That a budget of $33,400 be assigned to this program, with the funds be drawn from the Tax Levy for 2025. That the 2025 budget include $294,403 for organizations, that does not include Sustainable Peterborough, and Kawartha Sexual Assault Centre (less $3750) outlined on page 204 of the budget book and that the this be funded from the general Tax Levy. That the budget include additional funding of $3,750 for Kawartha Sexual assault Centre.

That Council approve the recommendation as follows: a) That Report CSSS24-024 be received for information. b) That the city shall provide a letter confirming the provision of $250,000 to be applied towards the costs of a business plan and preliminary studies, reports, and plans in support of a proposed 50 unit supportive housing project being advanced by Brock Mission and further that the said monies be derived from the Social services Reserve c) That council direct staff to collaborate with Brock mission in preparing an application for municipal incentives under the Affordable housing Community Improvement Plan (AHCIP), to be presented for council approval at a future date.

That staff be directed to consult with representatives of the DBIA on these and other shared priorities. That the OMPF Grant be amended from $300,000 to $358,800 (page 272) and to reduce the Net Tax Levy a) That, in accordance with recommendation #1 in the report from the Mayor’s Task Force for Housing Creation, a position for a Planning Project Manager be added to the Planning budget at a total cost of $170,017 including benefits; b) That this position be funded through the anticipated growth in applications for multi- unit developments and their associated fees.

That staff be directed to consult with representatives of the DBIA on these and other shared priorities. That the OMPF Grant be amended from $300,000 to $358,800 (page 272) and to reduce the Net Tax Levy a) That, in accordance with recommendation #1 in the report from the Mayor’s Task Force for Housing Creation, a position for a Planning Project Manager be added to the Planning budget at a total cost of $170,017 including benefits; b) That this position be funded through the anticipated growth in applications for multi- unit developments and their associated fees. That in anticipation of further deliberations on December 9, 2024 related to the 2025 Staff Recommended Budget, staff be directed to provide further options for reductions to City services, or additional sources of revenues, whereby an All-Inclusive Rate increase of 7.0% could be achieved, inclusive of the increases being requested by the Peterborough Police Services Board, Peterborough County City Paramedics and Peterborough Public Health.
That this meeting be adjourned at 7:44 p.m.
